snippet: An accelerated program of infrastructure projects, which people in both political parties agree are needed, has potential benefits beyond reducing unemployment.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column contends an accelerated program of infrastructure projects, which both political parties agree are needed, has potential benefits beyond reducing unemployment; holds both Pres Obama and presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney should be willing to take this politically feasible step that could help mend the economy quickly.
lead_paragraph: An accelerated program of infrastructure projects, which people in both political parties agree are needed, has potential benefits beyond reducing unemployment.

headline.print_headline: Repairing Roads Can End All Kinds Of Gridlock
headline.seo: Repairing Highways Could End Political Gridlock, Too - Economic View
headline.main: Repairing Roads Can End All Kinds of Gridlock
